description: Borrowed from Persian عطر‎ ('ater, “scent”), from Arabic عِطْر‎ (ʕiṭr, “perfume”).

entries.meaning: An essential oil extracted from flowers.
examples: I bequeath to you my literary work. Useless though these might be commercially, they are the attar-drops distilled from the long and futile ebullience of my life.

entries.meaning: A perfume made from this oil.
